internalToggle.notes: When public tiered pricing is enabled, expose Essential/Pro/Premium as selectable quantities with friendly per-article math.

tiers.name: Essential
tiers.description: 4 SEO-ready blog posts/month (≈800–1,200 words). Two review rounds each.

tiers.name: Pro
tiers.description: 6 SEO-ready posts/month with incremental SEO/PM time.

tiers.name: Premium
tiers.description: 8 SEO-ready posts/month; adds more strategist/editorial time for depth.

calculation.notes: Volume discount baked into Pro/Premium (implied per-article rate decreases with quantity).

scope: Monthly editorial calendar with prioritized topics (equal to article count)
SEO content briefs per article (query intent, outline, entities/terms, SERP notes)
Original draft writing (≈800–1,200 words) with two structured review rounds
Copyediting/proofing and on-page optimization (title, H-structure, meta, internal links recommendations)
Deliverables in Google Doc + Markdown/MDX (CMS-ready option via add-on)
Weekly status and trackers (briefs, drafts, approvals)
assumptions: Client provides brand voice guidance, ICP and product positioning (or recent content examples).
One consolidated reviewer; feedback within 3 business days per round.
Topics confirmed during monthly planning; minor swaps allowed before drafting begins.
Access to GA4/GSC (read-only) improves targeting but is optional.
exclusions: Original survey-based research, proprietary data analysis, or expert panel coordination.
Custom illustration/photography and stock image licensing.
access: Google Workspace (Docs/Drive) for drafts and briefs.
Optional SEO tools access (e.g., GSC/GA4 read-only; Clearscope/Surfer if client-licensed).
CMS staging access (if Publishing add-on is purchased).

scheduleTemplate: Week 1: Kickoff + topics + briefs; Draft #1 delivery
Week 2: Draft #2 delivery; Rev #1 for Draft #1 (if returned)
Week 3: Draft #3 delivery; Rev #1/2 as needed
Week 4: Draft #4 delivery; Final edits & packaging

roles.contentStrategist: Topic strategy, briefs, SEO alignment, calendar

qa: Fact check for claims and outbound links

pricing.paymentTerms: Net 15 (credit card/ACH). First month due at kickoff.

rushPolicy.definition: Requests requiring <3 business days from brief approval.

addons.label: CMS Publishing (staging + format + meta)
addons.notes: Assumes existing template; no template creation.

addons.label: Custom Diagram/Graphic
addons.notes: Simple line/shape diagrams; complex illustration out of scope.

addons.label: Internal Linking Refresh
addons.notes: Add/update internal links across new posts + 5 most relevant legacy posts.

internalPricingNotes: Implied per-article rate: Essential $600; Pro ~$580; Premium ~$550.
If articles <800 words or >1200 words, adjust capacity or price accordingly.
One SME interview included at Pro; two at Premium.

idealCustomer: B2B SaaS or services with defined ICP and mid-funnel content gaps
Teams publishing <4x/month wanting predictable cadence with SEO rigor
Stakeholders able to provide consolidated feedback on time
discoveryQuestions: Which products/personas are priority this quarter?
What are your north-star SEO metrics (keywords, pages, conversions)?
Who will review drafts and how quickly can they respond?
Do you have brand voice/style guidance or exemplars?
Which CMS do you use, and do you want us to publish?
commonObjections: ‘We need thought leadership, not just SEO.’
counters: Brief-led system + editor QA ensures consistency; samples and trial article available.
We layer POV + SME interviews; add Thought Leadership upgrades as needed.
We plan cadence around reviewer availability; clear SLAs and consolidated feedback.
landAndExpand: Add Hub/cornerstone content & internal linking refreshes
Spin off into newsletters/social, or add video summaries

risks: Insufficient SME access for technical topics

outOfScopeTriggers: Major topic pivot after draft started
Adding net-new sections that change article intent
changePolicy.process: PM raises a change request with time/cost impact; client approval required before work continues.

legal.sow: Content production retainer for monthly article pack.
legal.ip: Upon full payment, client owns final approved content.
warranties: All third-party assets licensed by client or pre-approved for fair use.
dataHandling: No storage of production credentials in unsecured docs.
PII not required; if provided, treat as confidential.

roadmap: Optional Thought Leadership variant (1,500–2,500 words, interview-led)
Programmatic content pilots (template + data source governance)
Repurpose blog posts into short social/video variants
